Simple API¶

pystmark.send(message, **kwargs)¶

Send a message.

Parameters:message (dict or PystMessage.) – Message to send.
Return type:PystSendResponse
pystmark.send_batch(messages, **kwargs)¶

Send a batch of messages.

Parameters:messages – Messages to send.
Return type:PystSendResponse
pystmark.get_bounces(**kwargs)¶

Get a paginated list of bounces.

Return type:PystBouncesResponse
pystmark.get_bounce(bounce_id, **kwargs)¶

Get a single bounce.

Parameters:bounce_id – The bounce’s id. Get the id with get_bounces().
Return type:PystBounceResponse
pystmark.get_bounce_dump(bounce_id, **kwargs)¶

Get the raw email dump for a single bounce.

Parameters:bounce_id – The bounce’s id. Get the id with get_bounces().
Return type:PystBounceDumpResponse
pystmark.activate_bounce(bounce_id, **kwargs)¶

Activate a deactivated bounce.

Parameters:bounce_id – The bounce’s id. Get the id with get_bounces().
Return type:PystBounceActivateResponse
pystmark.get_bounce_tags(**kwargs)¶

Get a list of tags for bounces associated with your Postmark server.

Return type:PystBounceTagsResponse
pystmark.get_delivery_stats(**kwargs)¶

Get delivery stats for your Postmark account.

Return type:PystDeliveryStatsResponse

Advanced API¶

Sending Email¶

class pystmark.PystSender(message=None, api_key=None, secure=True, test=False)¶

Sends a single message via the Postmark API.

All of the arguments used in constructing this object are used as defaults in the final call to PystSender.send(). You can override any of them at that time.

Parameters:
  • message (dict or PystMessage) – Default message data, such as sender and reply_to.
  • api_key – Your Postmark API key.
  • secure – Use the https scheme for Postmark API. Defaults to True
  • test – Make a test request to the Postmark API. Defaults to False.
response_class¶

alias of PystSendResponse

send(message=None, api_key=None, secure=None, test=None, **request_args)¶

Send request to Postmark API. Returns result of requests.post().

Parameters:
  • message (dict or PystMessage) – Your Postmark message data.
  • api_key (str) – Your Postmark API key.
  • test – Make a test request to the Postmark API.
  • secure – Use the https Postmark API.
  • **request_args – Passed to requests.post()
Return type:

requests.Response
class pystmark.PystBatchSender(message=None, api_key=None, secure=True, test=False)¶

Sends a batch of messages via the Postmark API.

All of the arguments used in constructing this object are used as defaults in the final call to PystBatchSender.send(). You can override any of them at that time.

Parameters:
  • message (dict or PystMessage) – Default message data, such as sender and reply_to.
  • api_key – Your Postmark API key.
  • secure – Use the https scheme for Postmark API. Defaults to True
  • test – Make a test request to the Postmark API. Defaults to False.
response_class¶

alias of PystSendResponse

send(messages=None, api_key=None, secure=None, test=None, **request_args)¶

Send batch request to Postmark API. Returns result of requests.post().

Parameters:
  • messages (A list of PystMessage) – Batch messages to send to the Postmark API.
  • api_key – Your Postmark API key. Defaults to self.api_key.
  • test – Make a test request to the Postmark API. Defaults to self.test.
  • secure – Use the https Postmark API. Defaults to self.secure.
  • **request_args – Passed to requests.request()
Return type:

PystSendResponse

Bounce API¶

class pystmark.PystBounces(api_key=None, secure=True, test=False)¶

Multiple bounce retrieval endpoint wrapper.

Parameters:
  • api_key – Your Postmark API key. Defaults to None.
  • secure – Use the https scheme for Postmark API. Defaults to True.
  • test – Make a test request to the Postmark API. Defaults to False.
get(bounce_type=None, inactive=None, email_filter=None, message_id=None, count=None, offset=None, api_key=None, secure=None, test=None, params=None, **request_args)¶

Builds query string params from inputs. It handles offset and count defaults and validation.

Parameters:
  • bounce_type – The type of bounces retrieve. See bounce_types for a list of types, or read the Postmark API docs. Defaults to None.
  • inactive – If True, retrieves inactive bounces only. Defaults to None.
  • email_filter – A string to filter emails by. Defaults to None.
  • message_id – Retrieve a bounce for a single message’s ID. Defaults to None.
  • count – The number of bounces to retrieve in this request. Defaults to 25 if message_id is not provided.
  • offset – The page offset for bounces to retrieve. Defaults to 0 if message_id is not provided.
  • api_key – Your Postmark API key. Defaults to self.api_key.
  • secure – Use the https scheme for Postmark API. Defaults to self.secure.
Params test:

Use the Postmark test API. Defaults to self.test.
Return type:

PystBouncesResponse
response_class¶

alias of PystBouncesResponse

class pystmark.PystBounce(api_key=None, secure=True, test=False)¶

Single bounce retrieval endpoint wrapper.

Parameters:
  • api_key – Your Postmark API key. Defaults to None.
  • secure – Use the https scheme for Postmark API. Defaults to True.
  • test – Make a test request to the Postmark API. Defaults to False.
get(bounce_id, api_key=None, secure=None, test=None, **request_args)¶

Retrieves a single bounce’s data.

Parameters:
  • bounce_id – A bounce’s ID retrieved with PystBounces.
  • api_key – Your Postmark API key. Defaults to self.api_key.
  • secure – Use the https scheme for Postmark API. Defaults to self.secure.
  • test – Make a test request to the Postmark API. Defaults to self.test.
  • **request_args – Keyword args to pass to requests.request().
Return type:

PystBounceResponse
response_class¶

alias of PystBounceResponse

class pystmark.PystBounceActivate(api_key=None, secure=True, test=False)¶

Bounce Activation endpoint wrapper.

Parameters:
  • bounce_id – A bounce’s ID retrieved with PystBounces. Defaults to None.
  • api_key – Your Postmark API key. Defaults to None.
  • secure – Use the https scheme for Postmark API. Defaults to True.
  • test – Make a test request to the Postmark API. Defaults to False.
activate(bounce_id, api_key=None, secure=None, test=None, **request_args)¶

  • api_key – Your Postmark API key. Defaults to self.api_key.
  • secure – Use the https scheme for Postmark API. Defaults to self.secure.
  • test – Make a test request to the Postmark API. Defaults to self.test.
